schema.name: AWS-GLACIER-PRICE
schema.description: Cost of one GiB storage from AWS glacier for one month. Unit: dollars

schema.name: ANNUAL-INCOME
schema.description: Annual income from selling storage on the storage market. Unit: dollars

schema.name: MONTHLY-INCOME
schema.description: Monthly income from selling storage on the storage market. Unit: dollars

schema.name: COMPARABLE-MONTHLY-COST
schema.description: Expected cost of purchasing monthly storage from commodity provider. Unit: dollars

schema.name: GIB-HOUR-SEAL-INVESTMENT
schema.description: Cost of investment required to seal one GiB in one hour at scale. Unit: dollars

schema.name: GIB-SEAL-COST
schema.description: Cost of sealing one GiB. Unit: dollars

schema.name: COMMODITY-STORAGE-DISCOUNT
schema.description: Fraction of commodity storage pricing expected as income from storage market. Unit: decimal fraction

schema.name: MINER-MONTHS-TO-CAPACITY
schema.description: Months it should take a miner to reach full storage capacity. Unit: months

schema.name: GIB-CAPACITY
schema.description: GiB of storage at full capacity. Unit: GiB

schema.name: TIB-CAPACITY
schema.description: TiB of storage at full capacity. Unit: TiB

schema.name: ANNUAL-TIB
schema.description: TiB of storage which must be brought online per year. Unit: TiB

schema.name: MONTHLY-TIB
schema.description: TiB of storage which must be brought online per month. Unit: TiB

schema.name: DAILY-TIB
schema.description: TiB of storage which must be brought online per day. Unit: TiB

schema.name: HOURLY-TIB
schema.description: TiB of storage which must be brought online per hour. Unit: TiB

schema.name: HOURLY-GIB
schema.description: GiB of storage which must be brought online per hour. Unit: GiB

schema.name: SEAL-CYCLES-PER-HOUR
schema.description: CPU required to seal at required rate for one hour. Unit: cycles

schema.name: SEAL-CYCLES-PER-MINUTE
schema.description: CPU required to seal at required rate for one minute. Unit: cycles

schema.name: SEAL-CYCLES-PER-SECOND
schema.description: CPU required to seal at required rate for one second. Unit: cycles

schema.name: GIB-SEAL-CYCLES
schema.description: Total CPU cycles required to seal 1 GiB. Unit: cycles

schema.name: NEEDED-GHZ
schema.description: Total GHz capacity needed to seal at the required rate.

schema.name: UP-FRONT-DRIVE-COST
schema.description: Up-front investment in hard drives required to store sufficient sealed data. Unit: dollars.

schema.name: UP-FRONT-MEMORY-COST
schema.description: Up-front investment in memory (RAM) required to seal at necessary rate. Unit: dollars

schema.name: UP-FRONT-COMPUTE-COST
schema.description: Up-front investement in compute hardware required to seal at necessary rate. Unit: dollars

schema.name: UP-FRONT-SEALING-COST
schema.description: Up-front investment in total hardware require to seal at necessary rate. Unit: dollars

schema.name: TOTAL-UP-FRONT-COST
schema.description: Total up-front investment required to generate MONTHLY-INCOME. Unit: dollars

schema.name: AVERAGE-MONTHLY-INCOME-DURING-RAMP-UP
schema.description: Average monthly income before miner reaches capacity (assuming linear growth). Unit: dollars

schema.name: INCOME-DURING-RAMP-UP
schema.description: Total income during ramp-up period (before reaching capacity). Unit: dollars

schema.name: INCOME-TO-FGR-AT-CAPACITY
schema.description: Income still required to reach filecoin growth rate equilibrium after reaching capacity. Unit: dollars

schema.name: FGR-MONTHS-AT-CAPACITY
schema.description: Months needed after reaching capacity before filecoin growth rate equilibrium.

schema.name: FGR-MONTHS
schema.description: Months after which a miner should reach filecoin growth rate equilibrium.

schema.name: ONE-YEAR-PROFIT-MONTHS
schema.description: Months from FGR to one year of profit. Unit: months

schema.name: ONE-YEAR-PROFIT
schema.description: Profit after one year of operation: Unit: dollars

schema.name: ONE-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: FGR after one year of operation: Unit: fraction

schema.name: TWO-YEAR-PROFIT-MONTHS
schema.description: Months from FGR to two years of profit. Unit: months

schema.name: TWO-YEAR-PROFIT
schema.description: Profit after two years of operation: Unit: dollars

schema.name: TWO-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: FGR after two years of operation: Unit: fraction

schema.name: THREE-YEAR-PROFIT-MONTHS
schema.description: Months from FGR to three years of profit. Unit: months

schema.name: THREE-YEAR-PROFIT
schema.description: Profit after three years of operation: Unit: dollars

schema.name: THREE-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: FGR after three years of operation: Unit: fraction

schema.name: SEAL-HZ
schema.description: Cycles per second at which the sealing machine operates. Unit: Hz

schema.name: SEAL-GHZ
schema.description: Cycles per second at which the sealing machine operates. Unit: GHz

schema.name: NODE-BYTES
schema.description: The number of bytes in a node -- must also be the hash digest size.

schema.name: SECTOR-GIB
schema.description: Size of one sector. Unit: GiB

schema.name: SECTOR-SIZE
schema.description: Size of one sector. Unit: bytes

schema.name: COMM-D-SIZE
schema.description: Size of the data commitment (CommD). Unit: bytes

schema.name: COMM-R-SIZE
schema.description: Size of the replica commitment (CommR). Unit: bytes

schema.name: COMM-R-STAR-SIZE
schema.description: Size of the aggregated commitment to each layer's replica (CommR*). Unit: bytes

schema.name: COMM-RS-SIZE
schema.description: Size of all replica commitments. Unit: bytes

schema.name: COMMITMENTS-SIZE
schema.description: Size of all commitments returned by Seal. Unit: bytes

schema.name: ON-CHAIN-POREP-SIZE
schema.description: On-chain size of one Seal proof plus commitments. Unit: bytes

schema.name: DEGREE
schema.description: Total in-degree of the ZigZag graph.

schema.name: BASE-DEGREE
schema.description: In-degree of the base depth-robust graph (DRG).

schema.name: EXPANSION-DEGREE
schema.description: Maximum in-degree of the bipartite expander graph component of a ZigZag graph.

schema.name: SLOTH-ITER
schema.description: Number of iterations of sloth verifiable delay encoding (VDE) to perform.

schema.name: PARTITIONS
schema.description: Number of circuit partitions into which a proof is divided.

schema.name: REPLICATION-TIME
schema.description: Time to replicate one sector. Unit: seconds

schema.name: REPLICATION-TIME-PER-BYTE
schema.description: Time to replicate one byte. Unit: seconds / byte

schema.name: REPLICATION-TIME-PER-GIB
schema.description: Time to replicate one GiB. Unit: seconds / GiB

schema.name: SEALING-TIME
schema.description: Total CPU time to seal (replicate + generate proof of replication) one sector. Unit: seconds

schema.name: NON-CIRCUIT-PROVING-TIME
schema.description: Time (including replication) to generate a non-circuit proof of replication. Unit: seconds

schema.name: VECTOR-COMMITMENT-TIME
schema.description: Time to generate the vector commitments used in a non-circuit proof of replication. Unit: seconds

schema.name: CIRCUIT-PROVING-TIME-PER-CONSTRAINT
schema.description: Groth16 circuit proving time (from benchmarks) per constraint. Unit: seconds

schema.name: ZIGZAG-TOTAL-PROVING-TIME
schema.description: Total time to generate a proof of replication (circuit and non-circuit). Unit: seconds

schema.name: SEAL-TIME
schema.description: Total time to seal (replication + proving) one sector. Unit: seconds

schema.name: WALL-CLOCK-SEAL-TIME
schema.description: Wall clock time sealing time using SEAL-PARALLELISM cores. Unit: seconds

schema.name: SEAL-PARALLELISM
schema.description: Number of cores utilized when computing wall-clock-seal-time.

schema.name: SECTOR-GIB
schema.description: Number of GiB in one sector. Unit: GiB

schema.name: GIB-SEAL-TIME
schema.description: Total time to seal (replication + proving) one GiB. Unit: seconds

schema.name: TOTAL-PARENTS
schema.description: Number of parents (or padding) each node uses when performing key derivation.

schema.name: HASH-FUNCTIONS
schema.description: Alternate hash functions for use in merkle-tree generation, KDF, or other commitments. All values here assume 64 bytes of raw input, but benchmarks include any extra, 'personalization', bits/bytes included as input during merkle-tree construction.

schema.name: SINGLE-KDF-HASHES
schema.description: Number of hashes performed as part of a single application of the key-derivation function (KDF). This is equal to the number of parents and includes the replica ID. Since we use Merkle-Damgard construction, the number of compression hashes is the number of elements - 1.

schema.name: KDF-HASHES
schema.description: Number of hashes performed as part of the key-derivation function (KDF).

schema.name: SINGLE-KDF-TIME
schema.description: Hashing time to perform a single KDF. Unit: seconds

schema.name: SINGLE-LAYER-MERKLE-HASHING-TIME
schema.description: Merkle hashing time for a single layer. Unit: seconds

schema.name: TOTAL-MERKLE-TREES
schema.description: Total merkle trees which must be generated.

schema.name: TOTAL-MERKLE-HASHING-TIME
schema.description: Total time to generate all merkle trees. Unit: seconds

schema.name: TOTAL-NODES-TO-ENCODE
schema.description: Total nodes to encode across all layers.

schema.name: SINGLE-NODE-SLOTH-TIME
schema.description: Time to perform sloth (VDE) for a single node. Unit: seconds

schema.name: SINGLE-NODE-ENCODING-TIME
schema.description: Time to encode a single node. Unit: seconds

schema.name: SINGLE-CHALLENGE-INCLUSION-PROOFS
schema.description: Number of inclusion proofs which must be verified for a single challenge.

schema.name: SINGLE-CHALLENGE-MERKLE-HASES
schema.description: Number of merkle hashes which must be verified for a single challenge.

schema.name: SINGLE-CHALLENGE-KDF-HASHES
schema.description: Number of KDF hashes which must be verified for a single challenge.

schema.name: SINGLE-CHALLENGE-SLOTH-VERIFICATIONS
schema.description: Number of sloth iterations which must be verified for a single challenge.

schema.name: TOTAL-KDF-HASHES
schema.description: Total number of KDF (key-derivation function) required during replication.

schema.name: TOTAL-ZIGZAG-KDF-HASHING-CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Total number of kdf hashing constraints in a ZigZag circuit.

schema.name: TOTAL-ZIGZAG-NON-HASHING-CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Total number of hashes which must be verified in a ZigZag circuit.

schema.name: TOTAL-ZIGZAG-CIRCUIT-KDF-HASHES
schema.description: Total number of KDF hashes which must be verified in a ZigZag circuit.

schema.name: TOTAL-ZIGZAG-SLOTH-CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Total number of constraints due to sloth verification.

schema.name: TOTAL-ZIGZAG-CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Total number of constraints which must be verified in a ZigZag circuit.

schema.name: LAYER-INDEX
schema.description: Index of layer. Unit: integer

schema.name: LAYER-REPLICATION-TIME
schema.description: Time to replicate one layer. Unit: seconds

schema.name: STORAGE-TO-PROOF-SIZE-RATIO
schema.description: Ratio of sealed sector size to on-chain PoRep size.

schema.name: STORAGE-TO-PROOF-SIZE-FLOAT
schema.description: Ratio of sealed sector size to on-chain PoRep size -- expressed as a float.

schema.name: SINGLE-CIRCUIT-PROOF-SIZE
schema.description: Size of a single Groth16 Proof. Unit: bytes

schema.name: TOTAL-CIRCUIT-PROOF-SIZE
schema.description: Total size of a single circuit proof. Unit: bytes

schema.name: KDF-HASH-FUNCTION.SIZE
schema.description: Size of digest (output) generated by *.HASH-FUNCTION.

schema.name: KDF-HASH-FUNCTION.CIRCUIT-TIME
schema.description: Time for one *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: KDF-HASH-FUNCTION.CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Number of constraints required to prove *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: KDF-HASH-FUNCTION.HASH-FUNCTION%
schema.description: Tuple containing the selected hash function's characteristics.

schema.name: MERKLE-HASH-FUNCTION.SIZE
schema.description: Size of digest (output) generated by *.HASH-FUNCTION.

schema.name: MERKLE-HASH-FUNCTION.CIRCUIT-TIME
schema.description: Time for one *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: MERKLE-HASH-FUNCTION.CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Number of constraints required to prove *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: MERKLE-HASH-FUNCTION.HASH-FUNCTION%
schema.description: Tuple containing the selected hash function's characteristics.

schema.name: ALPHA-HASH-FUNCTION.SIZE
schema.description: Size of digest (output) generated by *.HASH-FUNCTION.

schema.name: ALPHA-HASH-FUNCTION.CIRCUIT-TIME
schema.description: Time for one *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: ALPHA-HASH-FUNCTION.CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Number of constraints required to prove *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: ALPHA-HASH-FUNCTION.HASH-FUNCTION%
schema.description: Tuple containing the selected hash function's characteristics.

schema.name: BETA-HASH-FUNCTION.SIZE
schema.description: Size of digest (output) generated by *.HASH-FUNCTION.

schema.name: BETA-HASH-FUNCTION.CIRCUIT-TIME
schema.description: Time for one *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: BETA-HASH-FUNCTION.CONSTRAINTS
schema.description: Number of constraints required to prove *.HASH-FUNCTION in circuit.

schema.name: BETA-HASH-FUNCTION.HASH-FUNCTION%
schema.description: Tuple containing the selected hash function's characteristics.

schema.name: ZIGZAG-SOUNDNESS
schema.description: ZigZag soundness: Unit fraction

schema.name: ZIGZAG-LAMBDA
schema.description: ZigZag soundness: Unit bits

schema.name: ZIGZAG-EPSILON
schema.description: Maximum allowable deletion (space tightness): Unit: fraction

schema.name: ZIGZAG-DELTA
schema.description: Maximum allowable cheating on labels (block corruption)

schema.name: ZIGZAG-BASIC-LAYER-CHALLENGES
schema.description: Multiple of lambda challenges per layer, without tapering optimization.

schema.name: ZIGZAG-BASIC-LAYER-CHALLENGE-FACTOR
schema.description: Number of challenges which, when multiplied by lambda, yields the number of challenges per layer without tapering optimization.

schema.name: ZIGZAG-SPACE-GAP
schema.description: Maximum allowable gap between actual and claimed storage. Unit: fraction

schema.name: ZIGZAG-LAYER-CHALLENGES
schema.description: Number of challenges in this (indexed) layer of ZigZag PoRep. Unit: integer

schema.name: LAYERS
schema.description: Number of layers specified for this construction (not necessarily same as calculated from security parameters).

schema.name: MUST-HAVE-FILECOIN
schema.description: WE MUST HAVE FILECOIN -- SWEET, SWEET FILECOIN.

schema.name: SPACE-GAP-SATISFIED
schema.description: Is the actual space gap less than or equal to the maximum allowable space gap?

schema.name: FILECOIN-REQUIREMENTS-SATISFIED
schema.description: Are the Filecoin requirements all satisfied?

schema.name: MINIMUM-ONE-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: Minimum allowable FGR after one year.

schema.name: MINIMUM-TWO-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: Minimum allowable FGR after two years.

schema.name: MINIMUM-THREE-YEAR-FGR
schema.description: Minimum allowable FGR after three years.

schema.name: MINIMUM-STORAGE-TO-PROOF-SIZE-RATIO
schema.description: Minimum necessary storage to on-chain proof ratio.

schema.name: PROFIT
schema.description: â€¦ Profit.
